item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Trade Codes, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon never likes to make it easy to complete the Pokédex in any game, and the same challenges are presented in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, with some requiring trading. We’re here to help, though, with a full list of trade codes.

Trade codes in Pokémon Legends: Z-A are extremely beneficial as they allow you to skip past the long process of using social media platforms to organise trades with strangers, instead putting you straight into the thick of it by pairing you with a player who is looking for exactly the same thing as you.

Gone are the days when you needed to be in close proximity with a link cable; instead, complete your Pokémon Legends: Z-A Pokédex through the wonders of the internet using these trade codes.

There are 10 Pokémon in total that require trading to evolve in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, though some can be found in their evolved forms in the wild.

The likes of Alakazam, Gengar, Machamp, and Gourgeist are encounterable in the wild in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, though they can be rare, while Steelix can be caught via main story progression. If you want a readily available supply of the Pokémon, however, trading is the quickest means.

Below, you can find all the trade codes for Pokémon Legends: Z-A, courtesy of AustinJohnPlays. Be sure to check the receiving Pokémon before agreeing to a trade so you don’t get trolled!

Trading in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is not immediately available when you first start the game, as introductory points of the story must be completed before online access opens up.

Once you have unlocked online features in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, including the Mystery Gift and Trading, follow these steps to initiate a trade.

  1. Hit X on your Nintendo Switch controller to open the main menu.
  2. Scroll down to the ‘Link Play’ option.
  3. Select ‘Link Trade’.
  4. Choose the ‘Faraway Players’ option.
  5. Wait for your console to connect to the internet.
  6. Enter the designated code from the table above.
  7. Wait for a partner to be found.
  8. Select the Pokémon you wish you trade.
  9. Check that the Pokémon being offered is what you want and has any required items being held.
  10. Accept the trade.

Evolutions for Pokémon will trigger once they are received, adding to your Pokédex. If it’s your first time completing a Link Trade, you’ll also earn a stack of reward points towards Mable’s Research Tasks.

What Pokémon has been your MVP in Pokémon Legends: Z-A so far? Let us know your team in the Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Mortal Kombat 2 Movie Will Now Release a Week Earlier
item.content:encoded:
It’s only been a couple of months since it was officially announced that the Mortal Kombat 2 movie will be missing its 2025 release date and will be pushed back to May 2026; however, a new tidbit of news has once again changed the movie’s release date.

Moving from its pre-planned May 22nd, 2026 release date, Mortal Kombat 2 is not set to launch one week earlier on May 15, 2026.

Presumably, the date change is intended to give the film breathing room in what appears to be shaping up to be a busy month for movies in May. Notably, it avoids a same-day release as The Mandalorian and Grogu movie, which is set to launch on May 22nd.

Is Mortal Kombat 2 Avoiding GTA 6?

The movie industry usually doesn’t take note of video game releases, but it could be said that the release date move may also have been made to avoid Grand Theft Auto 6’s release date, which is currently scheduled for May 26th.

In the industry’s eyes, GTA 6 could be a once-in-a-lifetime event for the video game industry, causing millions of gamers to hunker down to play the game. Although movies don’t tend to take notice of video games, I think this is such an unprecedented release, that it was a wise decision if they decided to change because of it.

item.title: How Many People Can Play RV There Yet? RV There Yet Max Players, Explained
item.content:encoded:
You need to know how many people and players can play RV There Yet together if you’ve ever wanted to build haggard-looking contraptions to get an RV over obstacles, negotiate tight mountain roads leading to almost-certain death, and smoke stuff with a moose loose on the RV.

That was quite the opening paragraph, yet it encapsulates everything RV There Yet? is about. The Nuggets Entertainment project borrows the odd idea from PEAK—understandably, given PEAK’s unbelievable success—and adds its own flair.

One familiar gameplay is how many people can play RV There Yet? If you want to know if this is a co-op title with AI, or a fun party co-op game, you’re in the right place.

How Many Players Can Play RV There Yet Together?

RV There Yet? allows for a maximum of up to four players to work together to get the all-terrain vehicle where it needs to be.

The RV isn’t strictly an all-terrain vehicle, but you certainly need it to be to clear Route 65 in the game. Figuring out how to get past the next inconvenience is all part of the fun in RV There Yet?, and you can do so with at least three other players in your game.

Three of you can kick back and chill in the background, smoking and enjoying your best life, while one of you has the unenviable task of driving the RV and trying not to get it lodged in perilous positions. Exiting Route 65 is tough, but it’s better with friends, although it’s not technically a requirement.

Can You Play RV There Yet? Solo?

Officially, RV There Yet? can be tackled solo, but it’s not recommended, as the game wasn’t designed this way.

RV There Yet? is easily at its best when there are a few of you coming together. Would Among Us, Lethal Company, Content Warning, or any similar multiplayer game be as fun if you played them by yourself?

Plus, there’s the fact that a dev doesn’t recommend it: “[The] game is 2-4 players (technically can play solo but wasn’t made for that),” says jace on the official RV There Yet? Discord.

For now, we recommend following these instructions and finding one to three buddies to team up with.

If you do play RV There Yet? on your own, let us know how it goes and if it’s even possible to complete the game. For anything else, head on over to the Insider Gaming Discord to discuss the breakout hit or anything else gaming-related.

item.title: Is RV There Yet? On PlayStation, Xbox Or Nintendo Switch? Console Status Explained
item.content:encoded:
The age of climbing games continues with RV There Yet? Another manic title with enough comedic juice to fill a swimming pool. PC players are currently lapping up the bizarre action in it, but as an indie title, it means RV There Yet? on PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch consoles is unclear.

RV There Yet? is just as bonkers as it looks in the trailers. You navigate a classic RV through basic forests and woodland areas to the most perilous of scenarios and impossible-looking climbs. What could go wrong! It follows in the footsteps (and footholds) of PEAK and other climbing games.

Whether you love the genre or you want to get yourself into some chaotic mishaps, we have information on the game’s console status.

Can You Play RV There Yet? On PlayStation Consoles?

You currently can’t play RV There Yet? on PlayStation 4 or PlayStation 5 consoles.

That’s two down, unfortunately. RV There Yet can’t be played on current-gen or last-gen PlayStation hardware. It’s not a matter of whether the consoles can support the game—as we know they’re more than powerful enough—but it comes down to coding an indie PC game for a different platform, money, and other factors.

It could be a while until we see it on PlayStation, if ever.

Can You Play RV There Yet? On Xbox Consoles?

Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S players also have to miss out on RV There Yet? as it’s also not on Microsoft consoles for now.

It’s not going great. RV There Yet? also can’t make any stops for Xbox users. It’s a similar situation for the Xbox as it is for PlayStation, and until a wider console launch is announced, Xbox owners don’t get to experience RV There Yet either.

Can You Play RV There Yet? On Nintendo Switch?

It’s a clean sweep as RV There Yet? isn’t available on either the Nintendo Switch or the Switch 2 successor.

The original Switch had a habit of not incorporating wider third-party AAA titles, but would be home to indie titles—some of which Nintendo got first before PlayStation and Xbox, such as Hades.

However, there’s no such luck with RV There yet? Not even the more powerful and superior Switch 2 has a port lined up yet.

Will RV There Yet Ever Come To Consoles?

The game’s developer “isn’t sure” if RV There Yet will ever see the light of day on consoles.

RV There Yet’s Discord server is quite active, and one user asked: “Will the game release on console alongside Steam? (If it will have a console release at all?)

jace—a dev and community manager for the game’s Discord—said this concerning a console launch:

“No console release planned at this stage. And unfortunately I’m not great with hardware so I’m not sure.”

It’s not ruled out altogether. As with other breakout indie games, it will likely depend on the game’s long-term profitability, sustainability, and interest in a wider launch. We’ll let you know if the day comes when RV There Yet drives down to PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo demanding a console release.

Have you managed to get on RV There Yet? early, before the game goes viral? How do you think it compares to its contemporaries? Let us know through our own Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: ARC Raiders Roadmap, Explained—All Future ARC Raiders Plans
item.content:encoded:
New extraction shooter ARC Raiders is looking to ‘Embark’ on a long journey. Whether it has the legs remains to be seen, but we’ve extracted some new information about the shooter and the potential ARC Raiders roadmap of future content.

ARC Raiders is one of the big, new multiplayer dogs in 2025. With Call of Duty unable to crack the DMZ nut, Escape From Tarkov has largely had the genre to itself. Say hello to Embark Studios’ ARC Raiders!

The extraction shooter has had multiple betas—including the late-on Server Slam playtest—and it’s time to look forward instead of back.

Does ARC Raiders Have A Roadmap?

No, ARC Raiders doesn’t officially have a roadmap yet, as Embark Studios is unwilling to commit to additional content plans for the time being.

However, it doesn’t mean the developer isn’t thinking about the future, and this is evident with he shocking reveal that the ARC Raiders devs are already planning 10 years worth of content.

Embark Studios design lead Virgil Watkins said: “I think internally, for a very long time, we referred to this [ARC Raiders] as a 10-year game. That is the ambition we are aiming for and that dictates the type and quantity of content we want to put into it.”

We often see multiplayer games and single-player games with season passes announce future content before the current chunk of gameplay is out! ARC Raiders isn’t going down this path anytime soon, as these plans can “Spiral into promises that can go unfulfilled if things change.”

What New Content Is Coming To ARC Raiders?

Virgil Watkins has stated that ARC Raiders is likely to add fresh maps, more quests, and additional common-sense content throughout the game’s lifespan.

Here’s the design lead’s words in full: “Of course, adding things over time like new maps, extending questlines, and introducing new enemies and new weapons, and things like that. We’ll have some stuff lined up post-launch and for a little bit after, but then it will be based on what we see out of the launch and thereafter.”

It sounds like the typical content you’d come to expect from a post-game launch for an extraction shooter. We respect the fact that the team doesn’t want to put a timeframe on the new content and see how the launch plays out first.

Based on your time in any of the game’s playtests, what do you think ARC Raiders is lacking? It’s time to let us know via the Insider Gaming Discord server and the comments section below.

We have much more ARC Raiders content, including its price and whether it’s free to play, if there’s Launch Early Access, and ARC Raiders has optional progression wipes.

item.title: Legendary GTA Competitor ‘Scarface’ Coming to Steam and Epic with HD Graphics Mode
item.content:encoded:
In recent hours, eagle-eyed gamers have scoured repositories on Steam and Epic Games on PC to find out everything they can about a reappearance of 2006’s Scarface: The World is Yours. The open-world title emerged as a competitor to Grand Theft Auto on the PlayStation 2, but due to complex licensing issues, it was never revisited.

It now appears to be being brought back to life by a new publisher, and it is being given a new face with an HD graphics mode added as a DLC. In case you’re unfamiliar, The World is Yours puts players in the shoes of Tony Montana from the 1983 Scarface movie, presenting an alternate universe in which he survives an assassination attempt and must rebuild his drug empire.

Is Scarface: The World is Yours Coming Back?

Scarface: The World is Yours has always been one of those games that fans have desperately sought a remaster of. It was released in 2006 and offered a large open-world map of Miami, customization options, the ability to rebuild and decorate Tony Montana’s iconic mansion, and the gameplay loop facilitated the construction of an empire.

It was buggy as hell in many ways, and the PC port that was released way back when was a shambles, but on PlayStation 2, the game was a certified banger that still sits firmly in my mind twenty years later. It was originally pieced together by Radical Entertainment, the same studio that made The Simpsons Hit & Run and the Prototype games.

Scarface: The World is Yours was a heavily licensed game that featured Al Pacino’s likeness as Tony Montana, dialogue, direct-to-game story elements, a top soundtrack, and branding. This long presented a licensing concern when the discussion came about remastering or re-releasing the game.

Now, Hong Kong-based publisher EC Digital Entertainment appears to be floating the game on digital platforms for the first time. The unheard-of publisher seems to be backing a re-release of Scarface: The World is Yours on the Epic Store and on Valve’s Steam storefront, but no release date has been given.

It has been suggested by some users on social media that the Epic Games store, especially, has been ‘released early’ in what looks like some twisted backend glitch.

Scarface: The World is Yours is a game that all Grand Theft Auto fans should check out. It might have twenty years on it by now, but it’s a phenomenal title that was overshadowed by the earlier launch of GTA: San Andreas in late 2004 and the later launch of GTA: IV in 2008.
